revised_title: Substorm Processes in the Geomagnetic Tail and Their Effect on the Nightside Auroral Zone Ionosphere: Observations by EISCAT
tldr: The article discusses the magnetospheric substorm, a global phenomenon involving various physical processes. It reviews the current understanding of substorms and their relation to space-based and ground-based observations. The study focuses on the European incoherent scatter facility (EISCAT) measurements, which provide a more complete and continuous picture of the substorm processes. The article highlights the quasi-periodic nature of ionospheric flow effects and their relation to geomagnetic disturbances.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Magnetosphere and Ionosphere
